author: Veronicca Lakewood
comment: After the software engineer contacted me  it seemed to start working.  Before it was bringing up Idaho . So today I have accurate dew point temp and winds .  Be great if the engineer could developed a Garmin d2 clone with a metar feature in the motor 360 . Would pay for that ! I have a d2 and it just needs weather.

reply.author: Eugene Rakhmatulin
reply.content: I'm glad it worked for you! I've also sent some useful hints in the e-mail. Currently, I don't have any plans of developing any non-weather (such as navigation or E6B) capabilities of the app, however I plan to add more weather-related stuff there. Since I'm doing development in my spare time the amount of effort I can spend on it is fairly limited

title: Works now.

author: Lex Leonard
comment: The way you request and view weather is great, but the voice search is pretty much useless with airport codes. Not sure if that's the dev's fault. Would be cool to have a companion app on the phone for managing favorites.

reply.author: Eugene Rakhmatulin
reply.content: This is a limitation of Google voice recognition engine, I couldn't get it to recognize things like alpha, bravo, charlie consistently, it tried to substitute it with something else. That's why there is a manual code entry via dials.

title: Very nice design

author: Rich Adams
comment: Tried "nearest" the app crashed... Notification on phone "wear metar has stopped" subsequently followed by a burning hot watch and 20% battery drain in 5 minutes. Selecting an airport seems to work but is fiddly using the dials. Raw METAR/TAF would also be good. Nice idea though...

reply.author: Eugene Rakhmatulin
reply.content:
What watch and version of Android Wear are you running? Also what version of Android on your phone? Please make sure you enable location service.
Could you please try to uninstall and install again? Out of 1000+ active installations, this is the only complaint about crashing and draining the battery, so something might go wrong during the install?

title: Crashed followed by 20% battery drain in 5min

author: Adam Liston
comment: Kcbf crashes. Saying unfortunately wearMETAR has stopped.

reply.author: Eugene Rakhmatulin
reply.content: Just tried it, worked for me just fine. Maybe it was a temporary glitch - try again, please....

title: Good so far

author: Alan George
comment: Opened the app and it tells me that it can't connect. Full signal strength.
title: Can't  connect

author: Robert Stebbins
comment: I use it often when I want a quick weather report. The voice search works much better then others I've used, and can recognize the airport name with surprising accuracy.
title: Great product!

author: Goran Bogdanovic
comment: I cant get wx for any non-US airports. Is it just me?
title: Only US

author: C.Y. Shi
comment: It doesn't work with Android Wear 2.0 on Moto 360 Gen 2. :(

author: Michael Allen
comment: Simple app, works good.  Could be better if you could add TAFs.  Using Sony Smartwatch 3.

reply.author: Eugene Rakhmatulin
reply.content: TAFs are supported, just swipe left to switch from METAR to TAF view.

title: Handy

author: HeTian Huo
comment: If it includes more airports,like RJAA ZBAA, i will change it to a 5 star.

reply.author: Eugene Rakhmatulin
reply.content: Thanks for your rating! If anyone knows free, reliable and up to date database of all world airports with their names, city names and coordinates, it would help me to implement worldwide coverage sooner. Right now it's not the highest priority, as I have a backlog of features I want to implement first...

title: Great App!

author: Jon Russell
comment: Great app. Easy to read format.Well designed interface.  I like the dial in entry method.

author: Judson Vandiver
comment: I had originally reviewed that it did not work on the Moto 360.  That is because ESO(Equipment Superior to Operator).  All I had to do was re-sync my Moto 360 to my Nexus 5 and it worked flawlessly.  Thanks Eugene!
title: Works wonderfully!

author: Christopher Cicchitelli
comment: So awesome! Thank you for bringing this to Wear!
title: Key for Pilots

author: Rich Muniz
comment: If there was radar integrated I would give it 6 stars 😀

reply.author: Eugene Rakhmatulin
reply.content: It's actually in the works, but I need to roll out the new backend first. Since I'm working on it in my spare time, it can take a while, but I hope sooner than later, as being a pilot I actively use my app every day.

title: Does what it says,  works great!

author: Michael Vogt
comment: I contacted the dev when it was not working on the Moto 360 due to the round screen and within 18 hours he had an update available that fixed it. Awesome and thank you!  Great, quick, easy interface and easy on the eyes. Nice job!
title: Great support!

author: FLY&I
comment: Works great on my LG Watch. Very helpful for quick weather updates even when not in the Airplane. Gotta understand Metar Information of course.
title: Awesome App
